text: from seeing so many apis and probably
writing a bunch what are some good
practices
that you see that you follow
and what makes them good so being a
mobile developer i probably consume more
than i create i don't create so much
as perfect but
one thing that's always me i know this
might
rupture some feathers or something is
but i feel it's a bad practice
ah i'll just have to be brave when
you're sending an error
i send an error with an http response
code of 200.
i take that as like
i'm sorry but it's a really big red flag
for me i always feel that when i'm
designing apis the
error codes are there for a reason
so if i request a resource it's not
there it gives me a fault
if there's a problem on server give me
one of the 500 so i have one depending
on what set right is you know if the
resource has moved or sometimes 301 or
something but don't give me a 200 then
now give me a json and tell me error
then you give me a constructive like
error body with another
error code even when you return like a
400 or whatever you could return
an error body with your custom code if
you want that but let errors be errors
let uh responsible keep your response
okay
[Music]
